# API Examples

## Overview

This document provides practical examples for common {{repoName}} API workflows.

## Prerequisites

- A valid API token (see [Authentication](./03_authentication.md))
- `curl` or an HTTP client of your choice

## Example 1: List Resources

```bash
curl -X GET https://api.example.com/v1/resource?limit=10 \
  -H "Authorization: Bearer YOUR_TOKEN"
```

## Example 2: Create a Resource

```bash
curl -X POST https://api.example.com/v1/resource \
  -H "Authorization: Bearer YOUR_TOKEN" \
  -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
  -d '{"name": "Example", "description": "A sample resource"}'
```

## Example 3: Update a Resource

```bash
curl -X PUT https://api.example.com/v1/resource/RESOURCE_ID \
  -H "Authorization: Bearer YOUR_TOKEN" \
  -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
  -d '{"name": "Updated Example"}'
```

## Example 4: Delete a Resource

```bash
curl -X DELETE https://api.example.com/v1/resource/RESOURCE_ID \
  -H "Authorization: Bearer YOUR_TOKEN"
```

## Error Handling Example

```bash
# Handling a 429 rate limit response
# Retry after the number of seconds in the Retry-After header
```
